title: Trump discussing 'range of options' for Greenland, including military
subhed: The president is looking at a number of ideas for acquiring the self-governing Danish territory and using the US military is 'always an option,' the White House said on Tuesday. Earlier, Greenland and Denmark called for a speedy meeting with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio after Trump's renewed claims on Greenland.

title: Ukraine: Western allies agree on key security guarantees in Paris
subhed: Following the largest yet meeting of the so-called Coalition of the Willing in Paris, European leaders and the US hailed progress. The security guarantees include a US-led monitoring mechanism and a European multinational force that would be deployed after a ceasefire in Russia's war against its neighbor.

title: Venezuela: Iran risks losing a key economic and military ally
subhed: Tehran and Caracas have maintained close ties, particularly as a way to circumvent sanctions targeting both countries. The Islamic Republic, which is itself under threat from Washington, has projected a surface-level optimism.
byline: By Ghazal Golshiri and Madjid Zerrouky

title: AFCON 2025: Algeria reaches quarterfinals, Ivory Coast also advances
subhed: Players Adil Boulbina and Amad Diallo stole the show as Algeria and Ivory Coast scored contrasting last-16 victories in Morocco on Tuesday to complete the Africa Cup of Nations quarter-finals line-up.
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: 'If tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
subhed: Donald Trump's military operation in Venezuela should show Europeans that the US is a predator for Europe, just like Russia and China, argues former United Nations under-secretary-general Jean-Marie Guéhenno.

title: Cold snap hits Paris's homeless population hard
France's political parties divided over US operation in Venezuela
byline: By Sandrine Cassini, Mariama Darame, Corentin Lesueur and Alexandre Pedro

title: Thailand accuses Cambodia of breaking cease-fire, Cambodia claims an accident

Phil Gunson: If Trump does not force Venezuela to hold free elections, 'they can agree on almost everything'
Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
subhed: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.

title: US attack on Venezuela: What does international law say?
subhed: According to international law, 'fighting drug trafficking and protecting democracy do not constitute legal grounds for the use of force.'

title: They cook organic, distrust science and oppose vaccines: America's 'crunchy moms' shift toward Trump
subhed: In the 1960s, the 'crunchy mom' was typically an American hippie trying to stay connected to nature. Today, she claims total freedom over health decisions, sometimes flirting with conspiracy theories.

title: Greenland is and must remain European
The return of the US's predatory imperialism
'Trump and Putin share a common enemy, liberal Europe, but they have two divergent strategic projects'
